name: E. Vlad and an Odd Ordering
statement:
Vladislav has n cards numbered 1, 2,
dots, n. He wants to lay them down in a row as follows: First, he lays
down all the odd-numbered cards from smallest to largest. Next, he lays
down all cards that are twice an odd number from smallest to largest
(i.e. 2 multiplied by an odd number). Next, he lays down all cards that
are 3 times an odd number from smallest to largest (i.e. 3 multiplied by
an odd number). Next, he lays down all cards that are 4 times an odd
number from smallest to largest (i.e. 4 multiplied by an odd number).
And so on, until all cards are laid down. What is the k-th card he lays
down in this process? Once Vladislav puts a card down, he cannot use
that card again.
